main event: At 2205 a large, fast-moving object appeared on the radar screen, traveling from north to south over Two Jima Island on June 7, 1953.
interesting points: The object was observed for 20 minutes before disappearing off the south edge of the screen.,The object was estimated to be 10,000 feet in altitude and traveling at a speed of 1500 mph.,The radar signature of the object was much larger than any known aircraft in the area.,The object exhibited erratic changes in course and altitude.,The radar operator, Major Samuel Newton, expressed that this observation was unusual and warranted further investigation.
witness description: Major Samuel Newton, Base Radar Officer
